The plant features slender, erect stems with small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense, greenish-white inflorescences, and it produces small, triangular-shaped fruits. Acronia lacera is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
